description.narrative: The project aims to help transform national, regional and European policies and services to better protect refugees and asylum-seekers entering Greece. The first step is to deliver an up-to-date report of the human rights violations and practical difficulties therefugees and asylum-seekers face on their route through Greece and provide a suggested action plan to the authorities with a main focus on women and accompanied children. The European perspective will be covered through the Dublin regulation and the suggestion ofpolicy changes regarding its forthcoming reform in March 2016. The focus on women and accompanied children will be maintained in the review of the Dublin regulation and policy changes proposals. The report will not act as a standalone project and will not offer academic, vague positions but will be a concrete tool to form a campaign and mobilize the public. We have therefore included Media work and production of personal stories and videos that will sensitize the audiences in a more emotional way.

participating-org.narrative: ActionAid Hellas is one of the major Civil Society Organizations, working in Greece since 1998, officially registered as NGO at theMinistry of Foreign Affairs# records. It is well established and appreciated in the Greek society. More than 50.000 people support every year its action. ActionAid Hellas has been organizing campaigns for the past 7 years and lately has managed to achieve advocacy goals on a national level. Furthermore, the organization runs an emergency program in Lesvos with the support of the international team of emergency action IHART (International Humanitarian Action and Resilience Team) of Action Aid International

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
